All scatter plots in this study are fitted using linear functions in a least-square sense to assess the dependence of Y on X, i.e.,
\documentclass[12pt]{minimal} \usepackage{amsmath} \usepackage{wasysym} \usepackage{amsfonts} \usepackage{amssymb} \usepackage{amsbsy} \usepackage{mathrsfs} \usepackage{upgreek} \setlength{\oddsidemargin}{-69pt} \begin{document}$$Y = \alpha X + \beta .$$\end{document}
Y = α X + β .
Where α indicates the linear regression coefficient and β indicates the corresponding intercept.
